reviews.review_msg: Excellent professor! I love the way he teaches, and he is so funny. There are no exams or tests in this class. Just be prepared to read and do a reading response every week. Do the extra readings for bonus marks. You get out of it what you put in. I would take another class with Bascom again. I highly recommend his class.

For a class titled "introduction to anthropology", this class seems to prioritize climate change and topics in sustainability instead of the study of people. Mandatory participation and readings included, which are long and unreasonable. Professor also absolutely allows ZERO electronic devices at all under the pretense of anthropology... Comeon....

the prof himself is entertaining and he cares about his students and our learning, but the TA is such a tough grader and bascom is totally fine with their grading style. like yeah you'll enjoy the class and have some fun but the bad grade kinda turns things around. but tbh still a good class, just dont be dumb like me
Bascom is a great prof. He cares abou students. He is very approachable and we can learn a lot from him. He also has a good sense of humour. I would take his class again.

I agree with the previous comment. This guy doesn't move a limb in class but on his feedback he says that we should stand up. His grading is unfair. You may think you will end up with a good grade but then he would find tiny mistakes to give you a C. GUYS ,i cannot tell you how much of a waste of time this was his class.

He is kind but a very unfair grader. He doesn't move a limb during his lectures, yet he deducts significant marks  simply for sitting during presentations. He asks for 1 or 2 sentences of reflection for the assigned readings, but even when you provide a full paragraph, he comments "decent" and never gives you full marks or fair mark.

Bascom is really an amazing prof! He is super caring and teaches material thoroughly. There are no exams but there are reading responses and projects that count significantly towards your grade. He is not an easy marker but if you put in the work and show you care it will pay off. Got to say, one of the best and most memorable classes I have taken.

This is a great prof to have especially for first year! He is easily approachable and paces his course very well because you'll never find yourself stressing out about due dates nor the assignment overall.

I was glad there were no exams before I enrolled this course. Still, there's some reading responses that's due Sun. at noon, and a project that due at the semester. Still, I lliked how he plays some songs at the beginning of the Lec. Overall, you've rocked Bascom

there is weekly reading responses which are easy but take lots of time.
one project that you work on throughout the semester that is very fun.
you can tell he is very passionate about what he does and he makes the classroom environment fun.
attendance to lecture is mandatory.

Professor Bascom is an excellent professor at SFU, truly cares about the wellbeing of his students and is an interesting lecturer. His homework is reading heavy with around 30-50 pages of homework a week, but nothing you can't knock out in a few hours. Climate-Change is important for this class.

Bascom is the most caring prof I've had so far. Although his course was reading heavy, and the lectures weren't as invoking, he tries his best to not give so much work and give breaks. He is very comforting and cracks jokes here and there, and no it's not boomer humour. He is sweet, understanding, and you can tell he's passionate

Bascom has a great personality and is a pleasant person to be around, but he gives a lot of readings per week. Or at least what I feel is a lot, which is about two articles every week with an average of 30-40 pages each and they are often wordy/dense. He will also make you do lots of discussions related to the material so you have to read it all.

The class had a heavy environmental focus. Lots of related readings to climate change. If this isnt your thing, DO NOT take this course. Lectures were pretty much useless and the TA made it impossible to get a perfect score through their grading (actually told us it was impossible to achieve an A).

FUNNY TEACHER! Brings positive vibes to the classroom so you actually WANT to attend. Gives readings every week which is not the worst thing in the world I guess but they are LONG (and many) pages. Tutorial attendance is mandatory as it is to your participation mark

Probably one of the best profs ever. No examinations and cared more for your learning experience, his playlists are wonderful as well as his attitude/jokes. Participation will help you and assignments engaged your personal interests and perspectives of the world which is what you think to expect from other profs but he a rare one so enjoy !!

Hard work pays off in his classes. Lots of readings, but from a very good selection. He is funny and witty. Lectures are never boring. Very respectful and approachable. Lectures are engaging. He loves what he does and his energy is always great! So is his music playlists!

Bascom is literally the best professor I've ever had. He doesn't believe in exams so you won't have to do any of that. Assignments are interesting and his lectures are simply delightful. TAKE HIS CLASSES. I've taken 5 courses with Bascom and you probably will too if you try one of his classes out.

Bascom is super chill and if you're in his class, you never have to do exams. He personally don't like it so he never gives exams. Participation is extremely important but he always make stuff interesting so I'm more than happy to participate. He gives easy Bs i would say. If you want an A, then you got to work for it but that's fair.
love him and definitely recommend him
SUPER FUN AND ENJOYABLE CLASS. SURPRISED HE ISN'T A 5 RATED PROF

Bascom is a very caring professor that tries to make 8:30 am lectures more entertaining by incorporating stories into his lectures and provides lots of great feedback in his emails. He really tries to help students understand more and this course consist of weekly readings but no test and just very fun projects.

I love Bascom. He is my favourite professor at SFU. He is passionate and dedicated in his work. He speaks his mind and one of the few teachers who is honest with his class. I have so much respect for him and look up top him. The class was so much fun and very straightforward. Weekly responses and a semester long project. Overall recommend him.

Amazing prof and no tests so thats great. Lots of reading and discussions but the topics are always very interesting. The final project and major papers are also very interesting and can basically be about anything you want. He marks a little hard but I would definitely take a class with him again.
Great prof who allows students to be creative in the classroom. 10/10 recommend
Classes were really fun, he was really approachable and gave feedback. Lectures weren't boring, we got to watch videos, participation was fun and classes felt like a natural dialogue.

Bascom is a caring and approachable prof. He tends to go off topic, but he does put in effort to make the material interesting. No exams and only 2 papers, which is easy for a 4 credit class! But class has weekly reading responses, and the readings can be long and dense for a first year class.

Reading responses due every week! Workload was average, lectures were extremely boring. Talks about topics of the reading response that was already handed in. Makes funny references though, not a bad class.

Super fun class, it is about video games. But Bascom is passionate about the topic which is helpful, the games are okay to play but learning about them more academically is very interesting. Bascom is always ready to talk about other topics or questions you had and gives good feedback in the weekly reading responses. 10/10 would recommend

Loved this class. The lectures were long but I found them quite interesting. Bascom was also my TA for this class hes great and tutorials are pretty chill with bascom. Try getting bascom as ur TA too. I found he was a pretty fair marker. Assignment every week but its not too heavy. Would recommend this prof

Pretty good lecturer. Bland (but socially relevant) material. The class draws you in with the appeal of no exams, but the weekly reading responses and three papers are draining (and are marked hard). Plays music before class and at break. Swears a lot (I think to try to be hip with the kids). Most of the readings are okay, but the book kinda sucks.

Overall, enthusiastic & caring prof. There are no exams (which is nice); however, there are weekly reading assignments in which you may read anywhere from 3-4 different readings and provide short responses for each one (which as mentioned, can be tedious) Three essays, ranging from 6-8 pages. LEC & TUT attendance/participation are taken (worth 10%)
Best prof ever. Nice guy.

Overall a manageable and fair class. Weekly reading responses were a bit tedious but not terrible. All the paper topics were very flexible and addressed real-life issues, which was actually useful to learn about. Jeremy was a great TA and a fair marker so get him! If you're a strong writer it'll be easy to score a high mark in this course.

Was kind of frustrated with this prof, the course seemed like it had interesting content but the structure of the course was annoying and I feel like I learned nothing. It seems easy because there are no tests but the essay topics are difficult and the prof is unhelpful about narrowing down what it is he wants you to write.
Hes a great prof and really funny. Class was an easy pass but the readings were heavy and the tutorials were boring (depending on the TA)

Bascom is great. The reading material he assigns are based off his weekly lectures. Every week we had to summarize the readings (usually around 4-5, but it's an upper level class) and had to analyze them. Fairly easy to get a good mark. No tests! He made us do a final group report, which included a written report, research, and a presentation.

he just likes to hear himself talk. there is no tests but there are three papers plus weekly reading summary reports to do. class isnt needed to write the papers but attendance is 10% of the grade and there are no allowed absences. prof is nice but that's the only thing going for this course. not that interesting, was disappointed in this course.
No textbooks. I mean there are but theyre free

This class doesn't have any exams- which seems cool until you realize that you have to do weekly reading responses to a ridiculous amount of readings. Your papers are graded unfairly (67% with little to no constructive feedback..) maybe it was just my TA who is the worst. Lectures are boring and not motivating. I hate this class.

Bascom is a really happy and passionate prof that loves to talk. He can sometimes get really caught up in what he's talking about and forget to engage the class. He also loves to ask questions and pick people out to answer.

He's a pretty chill guy, but his lectures were really dry and not very informative. there's no exams but 3 papers that lectures don't help with. the weekly reading responses are slightly tedious but manageable. he really enjoys group discussions. not sure if he'll assign a book in the future as the library has a copy online now

Bascom is a caring prof that discusses anthropology in a very grounded way with many examples. There were 3 papers and no exams, which was nice, but the lectures didn't really help with the papers, and they got a bit boring sometimes because he likes to go on long tangents. Other than that, easy course and good prof.

Be ready for lots of tedious and boring writing assignments! Group projects are a bit of a hassle but the seminars are fun and informative. Overall Bascom is a good prof, but I would only take another class if I was enrolled in a maximum of 3. An incredible amount of work is expected with little sympathy to workloads from other classes.

Bascom is a really fun prof I had him for tutorials as well and he makes class enjoyable even though lectures are 2 hours long plus another 2 for tutorial I never got tired of him the only thing is the weekly readings are time-consuming and also attendance is mandatory but overall i love bascom and i wish he taught my other classes as well

He has almost all the readings online which cuts down txtbook costs. There are weekly reading assignments which can be tedious but it helps maintain your writing skills for the papers. This course is paper based, no tests. Papers are how to apply the concepts. You have 3 papers which are manageable and he makes anthro interesting. Participation 10%

Super fun prof. Really easy to talk to. There are no tests or exams in this class- just 3 papers. Reading responses due every Sunday. Textbook isn't exactly required but is needed for the last 3 reading responses. Would take this class again!

Lectures did get more boring as the semester went on. He likes to talk A LOT about his experiences in India. Nice guy though, and some of his music before class and during breaks was pretty good. No tests, but 3 papers worth 20% or more and little reading responses each week.

a pretty chill dude, good interesting lectures. good ta  good experience. weekly reading responses are annoying but not toooo difficult. no tests is really great. a lot of understanding ideas, not memorizing specific things. 10/10 would recommend Bascom my boy. best DJ ever.

Bascom is my favourite prof at SFU. He makes class enjoyable to attend. He is also very accessible for any help you need regarding anything. The only thing is that there is a lot of reading per week that you have to summarize in weekly online discussions. But it is still manageable.

The lectures were more boring as the weeks went on. The weekly reading responses are a little annoying, but better than a test! That being said he can be a tough marker for papers and the like. Bascom is annoyingly liberal to the point where he gets offended about things that are not even a problem (and that's coming from a liberal myself). Meh.
Best prof I have ever had.

Bascom was clearly well educated on all of the topics and brought forth great thought evoking ideas as well as encouraged respectful discussion. The weekly reading responses are a little annoying but end up not being worth much, plus no tests! That being said he can be a tough marker for papers and the like. Overall, great prof :)

Bascom was one of the most excellent profs I've had so far! Class was so enjoyable to attend, even though he was a tough marker and gave you plenty to read. (5 ethnographies).  Lots of work, but no exams. Definitely worth it taking!
Bascom was one of the best professors in SFU! Even though its my first semester at SFU he's one of the prof I would take all of  my classes if I could!
